data.title: Same user in tcacs and local database gets authenticated
data.description: Symptom: Configure mgmt auth as local and then aaa. >show aaa auth Management authentication server order: 1............................................ local 2............................................ tacacs Configure a user "admin" on both local and tacacs. with different passwords on local make admin as read-only. If login with user admin and tacacs password, i am till getting authenticated. But local user log say s user us rejected. If user is rejected, then there should be no failover. Conditions: Configure mgmt auth as local and then aaa. >show aaa auth Management authentication server order: 1............................................ local 2............................................ tacacs Configure a user "admin" on both local and tacacs. with different passwords on local make admin as read-only. If login with user admin and tacacs password, i am till getting authenticated. But local user log say s user us rejected. If user is rejected, then there should be no failover. Workaround: na Further Problem Description: na

Workaround: na Further Problem Description: na

data.title: WLC: Due to WLC code change in 8.7, if token is empty WLC is not reinitiating JWT enrollment process
data.description: Symptom: WLC is not able to send data to DNAC Conditions: WLC showing 'unauthorized JWT token' in error Workaround: In 8.7, if token is empty WLC is not reinitiating JWT enrollment process. Workaround : configure a token manually, & re-add the WLC on DNA. On re-add, JWT enrollment process will restart as token is not empty. JWT enrollment should be successful later. Further Problem Description:

cdets.headline: WLC: Due to WLC code change in 8.7, if token is empty WLC is not reinitiating JWT enrollment process
cdets.releaseNote: Symptom: WLC is not able to send data to DNAC Conditions: WLC showing 'unauthorized JWT token' in error Workaround: In 8.7, if token is empty WLC is not reinitiating JWT enrollment process. Workaround : configure a token manually, & re-add the WLC on DNA. On re-add, JWT enrollment process will restart as token is not empty. JWT enrollment should be successful later. Further Problem Description:

data.title: Controller-Unable to add /delete DCA channels in RF-Profile while Channel width configured as 80 MHz
data.description: Symptom: When we configure 80 or 40 MHZ in Rf-Profle, unable to add/delete the DCA channels in RF-Profile. Getting the below warning. "Configured DCA channels are in invalid combination for the selected channel width". Conditions: RF profile 8.8.100.0 8.8.111.0 Workaround: Further Problem Description:

data.title: Cisco 1542, 1562 APs failed to get ARP entry for WLC
data.description: Symptom: 1542/1562 Failed to get ARP entry for WLC Conditions: 1542/1562 Failed to get ARP entry for WLC, Workaround: downgrade to 8.7. Further Problem Description:

cdets.headline: Cisco 1542, 1562 APs failed to get ARP entry for WLC
cdets.releaseNote: Symptom: 1542/1562 Failed to get ARP entry for WLC Conditions: 1542/1562 Failed to get ARP entry for WLC, Workaround: downgrade to 8.7. Further Problem Description:

data.title: XOR Radio in 5GHz is sending some traffic at disabled data rates
data.description: Symptom: network is configured with 24 Mbps as lowest enabled data rate for high density deployment. We are seeing some traffic sent by the AP transmitted at 6 Mbps. Conditions: behavior persists with either global parameters or RF profile behavior seen on XOR with dart connector Traffic seen at 6 Mbps includes some ACKs, CTS, Block ACK REQs, and VHT NDP Workaround: N/A Further Problem Description: N/A

cdets.headline: XOR Radio in 5GHz is sending some traffic at disabled data rates
cdets.releaseNote: Symptom: network is configured with 24 Mbps as lowest enabled data rate for high density deployment. We are seeing some traffic sent by the AP transmitted at 6 Mbps. Conditions: behavior persists with either global parameters or RF profile behavior seen on XOR with dart connector Traffic seen at 6 Mbps includes some ACKs, CTS, Block ACK REQs, and VHT NDP Workaround: N/A Further Problem Description: N/A

data.title: 'show run-config commands' includes weird lines
data.description: Symptom: 'show run-config commands' includes weird lines; This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth add' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth enable' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth server-timeout' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth mgmt-server-timeout' instead. Conditions: exec 'show run-config commands' Workaround: ignore this lines Further Problem Description:

cdets.headline: 'show run-config commands' includes weird lines
cdets.releaseNote: Symptom: 'show run-config commands' includes weird lines; This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth add' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth enable' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth server-timeout' instead. This command has been deprecated! Please use 'config tacacs auth mgmt-server-timeout' instead. Conditions: exec 'show run-config commands' Workaround: ignore this lines Further Problem Description:

data.title: Cisco 5508/ 5520 controller running 8.5.140.0 dropping all wireless clients
data.description: Symptom: 5520/5508 WLCs on code 8.5.140.0 The issue is with wireless clients not able to connect to the AP/WLAN. This issue is seen intermittently once in every few days. When the issue happens the client count on the WLC shows to be zero. a failover to the secondary N+1 WLC to revive the network. The following Is seen in the WLC msglog when the client count is zero *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.938: %OSAPI-0-TIMERCB_ALLOC_FAILED: [SA]timerlib.c:648 Unable to allocate timer control block. -Traceback: 0x119004f 0x5f9279 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.934: %APF-1-MOBILE_ENTRY_CREATE_FAILED: [SA]apf_ms.c:4596 Could not create Mobile Station Entry. Unable to lock existing entry or create timers. Mobile:40:9c:28:b8:ea:61, Type: LWAPP AP. Mobile rejected. -Traceback: 0x5f92e4 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.934: %OSAPI-0-TIMER_CREATE_FAILED: [SA]timerlib.c:688 Failed to create a timer. -Traceback: 0x119008d 0x5f9279 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d 19 Mon Mar 25 08:55:22 2019 Capwap Retransmission Queue Full for AP dc:7b:94: 87:18:70 20 Mon Mar 25 08:55:22 2019 Capwap Retransmission Queue Full for AP dc:7b:94: The logs are not seen once the Aps are moved to the failover WLC. Free timer counter has reached zero: Total Timers..................................... 150000 Allocated.................................... 149994 Free......................................... 6 Peak Usage................................... 150000 Conditions: Seen on a WLC in AP SSO HA mode, with active mobility tunnels to a peer. WLC is doing DTLS mobility to a peer, and there have been multiple mobility tunnel flaps Workaround: failover to the secondary N+1 WLC to revive the network Further Problem Description:

cdets.headline: Cisco 5508/ 5520 controller running 8.5.140.0 dropping all wireless clients
cdets.releaseNote: Symptom: 5520/5508 WLCs on code 8.5.140.0 The issue is with wireless clients not able to connect to the AP/WLAN. This issue is seen intermittently once in every few days. When the issue happens the client count on the WLC shows to be zero. a failover to the secondary N+1 WLC to revive the network. The following Is seen in the WLC msglog when the client count is zero *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.938: %OSAPI-0-TIMERCB_ALLOC_FAILED: [SA]timerlib.c:648 Unable to allocate timer control block. -Traceback: 0x119004f 0x5f9279 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.934: %APF-1-MOBILE_ENTRY_CREATE_FAILED: [SA]apf_ms.c:4596 Could not create Mobile Station Entry. Mobile rejected. -Traceback: 0x5f92e4 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d *apfMsConnTask_2: Mar 25 08:52:51.934: %OSAPI-0-TIMER_CREATE_FAILED: [SA]timerlib.c:688 Failed to create a timer. -Traceback: 0x119008d 0x5f9279 0x5fc368 0x5142d6 0x527b48 0x1185603 0x3ba6c07dff 0x7f338e18439d 19 Mon Mar 25 08:55:22 2019 Capwap Retransmission Queue Full for AP dc:7b:94: 87:18:70 20 Mon Mar 25 08:55:22 2019 Capwap Retransmission Queue Full for AP dc:7b:94: The logs are not seen once the Aps are moved to the failover WLC. Free timer counter has reached zero: Total Timers..................................... 150000 Allocated.................................... 149994 Free......................................... 6 Peak Usage................................... 150000 Conditions: Seen on a WLC in AP SSO HA mode, with active mobility tunnels to a peer. WLC is doing DTLS mobility to a peer, and there have been multiple mobility tunnel flaps Workaround: failover to the secondary N+1 WLC to revive the network Further Problem Description:
